meanings.definition: To enclose within brackets for clarity or emphasis.
meanings.sent1: She was bracketing the important information in her notes.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reminded the students to practice bracketing key points in their essays.
meanings.sent3: The chef was so focused on bracketing the ingredients that he accidentally spilled the salt.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bracketed the room, drawing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes bracketed the focal point of the painting beautifully.

meanings.definition: The act of placing brackets around something.
meanings.sent1: The bracketing of the equation made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent2: His bracketing of the quotes in the text helped with understanding.
meanings.sent3: The bracketing of the cupcakes with colorful wrappers made them look festive.
meanings.sent4: The bracketing of the garden with flowers created a lovely border.
meanings.sent5: The bracketing of the title on the cover page made it stand out.

meanings.definition: A pair of symbols used to enclose words or numbers for clarity.
meanings.sent1: The student used bracketing to highlight the key terms in the paragraph.
meanings.sent2: In math, bracketing is essential for indicating the order of operations.
meanings.sent3: The bracketing of the phone number in the advertisement caught the eye of many customers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a pair of bracketing parentheses, framing her face.
meanings.sent5: The bracketing of the quote in the speech emphasized its importance.
